Articles
Email
The Hot New Medium Is … Emailhttp://www.wired.com/wired/archive/6.04/es_lists.html
enHTMLDavid S. Bennahum19984This is an interesting taxonomy of mailing lists.
Science Puts Enron E-Mail to Usehttp://archive.wired.com/science/discoveries/news/2006/01/70100
enHTMLRyan Singel2006130Using Enron emails as a test playground for analysis algorithms.
10 e-mail habits that waste time and cause problemshttp://www.townofstratford.com/filestorage/39879/40040/40042/10_common_e-mail_habits_that_waste_time_and_cause_problems.pdf
frPDFCalvin Sun200772Some basic but, nevertheless, good advice on emailing.
YouTube
10 Ways to make yourself a YouTube Starhttp://www.theregister.co.uk/2006/08/11/10_ways_to_make_you_a_youtube_star/
enHTML2006811As said in the title…
An anthropological introduction to YouTubehttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TPAO-lZ4_hU
enFlash Video5534Michael Wesch2008623A very positive view of the YouTube phenomena. This is not a real anthropological study, just a list of rather affected ideas.
Where the Hell is Matt?http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VVcwqQlwnmY
enFlash Video5832Matt Harding2008818Matt explains why and how he has done his three "dancing" around the world videos.
Search
Google
Google: "Goggles Does NOT Do Face Recognition"http://spectrum.ieee.org/tech-talk/consumer-electronics/portable-devices/google-goggles-does-not-do-face-recognition
enHTMLSally Adee2010824Google says it will deliver its visual search before the end of the year, but it will not support facial recognition, despite the fact it already has the technology.
10 Concerns With Google InstantInstant is a dramatic move and will likely change Web business and how consumers use the Web in a number of wayshttp://www.devx.com/webdev/Article/45570
enHTMLAlex Genadinik2010910The author tries to predict the impact of Google instant search, but, in fact, he has very few things to say and his arguments are not very convincing.
The Structured Search Enginehttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5lCSDOuqv1A
enFlash Video11933Andrew Hogue2011119A presentation of FreeBase (a semantic knowledge database) and Google Squared (a elements/attributes table generated from Internet data).
Can Google survive its blind faith in the algorithm?http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/hiner/can-google-survive-its-blind-faith-in-the-algorithm/9654
enHTMLJason Hiner20111031Google has more and more trouble getting rid of content farms and, while trying to do so, it impacts some good sites at the same time. The author claims search will be obsoleted by social networks. I disagree, I cannot see how social networks will help routinely find information when you need it.
The Epic Saga of The Wellhttp://www.wired.com/wired/archive/5.05/ff_well.html
enHTMLKatie Hafner19975The history of the most well known BBS.
Nicole Sullivan, "Don't Feed The Trolls" - Fluent 2012http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ulNSlES1Fds
enFlash Video1246Nicole Sullivan2012530How to deal with trolls and not being a troll oneself.
Une banale histoire de procès sur Internethttp://vidberg.blog.lemonde.fr/2013/07/20/une-banale-histoire-de-proces-sur-internet/
frHTMLMartin Vidberg2013720The story of the trial MyWittyGames vs Tric Trac.
